title: Amitav Ghosh on ‘The Ghost Eye’, reincarnation & climate crisis | Exclusive interview
description:
In this exclusive conversation, acclaimed author Amitav Ghosh dives into the making of The Ghost Eye, discussing how the story came to him, the craft behind shaping fiction, and the surprising links to his earlier works.
He speaks about reincarnation, parallel worlds, the Sundarbans, climate change, food culture, and why certain landscapes continue to shape his imagination.
From the emotional and ecological power of the mangroves to the political consequences of global climate denial, Ghosh shares insights that are both urgent and timeless.
He also reflects on his writing process, the role of food in storytelling, and the challenge of creating a book for the Future Library project, to be read 89 years from now.
Watch the full interview for a deep, thoughtful look into one of India’s most celebrated literary minds.

Interview: Ramya Kannan 
Production: Shikha Kumari A

title: Noida techie death: Trucker rammed into same boundary wall 10 days ago; yet no repair
description: A 27-year-old software engineer tragically drowned after his SUV plunged into a deep, water-filled pit in Noida's Sector 150. The same damaged wall had been hit by a truck just days prior. Despite repeated warnings and a prior incident, no repairs were made, sparking outrage and administrative action.
